channel.title: Editing Source with Eclipse
channel.description:
I am rather new to Java and very new to Eclipse.
Eclipse is a Java IDE I use for my college Java course. I wanted to look through the source. I am having problems viewing the actual source code though. I imported the .JAR archive file into Eclipse but I only see a few packages, none that include any class files.
I get the following packages from importing the JAR file.
javazoom.jl.converter javazoom.jl.decoder javazoom.jl.player.advanced sign
as well as the System Library and a META-INF folder.
When I click on import I get a list of all the class files but none of them are actually imported into my project. Does anyone else have an ideas on why this happens? (Does anyone else even use eclipse?) Or does anyone have any recommendations for a better IDE.
-KilaByte-

item.title: Editing Source with Eclipse
item.dc:creator: @xEnt xEnt
item.description:
@xEnt wrote:

That’s not what a archived reference library is for.

In Eclipse, Click Project at the top, then Properties then click Java Build Path, then click the tab Libraries then Add External Jars, point to your jar and your done.

Read full topic

item.title: Editing Source with Eclipse
item.dc:creator: @KilaByte KilaByte
item.description:
@KilaByte wrote:

That worked. Now I can access all of the class files. I had no idea you could extract a Jar file via winrar.

Thanks for the help.

-KilaByte-

Read full topic

item.title: Editing Source with Eclipse
item.dc:creator: @freaky5000 freaky5000
item.description:
@freaky5000 wrote:

Best bet, just to extract all the .class files out of the jar with winrar…?

Read full topic
